item.title: PI Models + int's
item.dc:creator: @Primate Primate
item.description:
@Primate wrote:

so i wanted to add completionist cape, downloaded the .dat’s and put them in my cache/raw, i then went to itemdef and added this (hood)

case 4317:
        itemDef.modelid = 65273;
        itemDef.name = "Completionist hood";
        itemDef.modelZoom = 760;
        itemDef.modelRotationY = 11;
        itemDef.modelRotationX = 81;
        itemDef.modelOffset1 = 1;
        itemDef.modelOffset2 = -3;
        itemDef.anInt165 = 65292;
        itemDef.anInt200 = 65310;
        itemDef.groundActions = new String[5];
        itemDef.groundActions[2] = "Take";
        itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
        itemDef.itemActions[1] = "Wear";
        itemDef.itemActions[4] = "Drop";
        itemDef.editedModelColor = new int[4];
        itemDef.newModelColor = new int[4];
        itemDef.editedModelColor[0] = -322;
        itemDef.editedModelColor[1] = -336;
        itemDef.editedModelColor[2] = -350;
        itemDef.editedModelColor[3] = -2541;
        itemDef.newModelColor[0] = -322;
        itemDef.newModelColor[1] = -336;
        itemDef.newModelColor[2] = -350;
        itemDef.newModelColor[3] = -2541;
    break;

i then went into item.cfg and changed some id’s of team capes to completionist cape.

i’m now ingame and when i attempt to spawn the id’s (old teamcapes) i still get teamcape and not completionist cape

What do i do? never done this before.

i also dont think i have ::addmodel ####
however nex armours have been added by the original coder of the source

Read full topic
